attributes.action: To have our situation noticed and supported and to not be victimized
attributes.additional_details: information can be given upon request
attributes.background: we have received an enforcement notice telling us to vacate our land and to remove livestock, we have been told we will not get planning permission even if we apply. They gave us the notice 2 days after major surgery and is now affecting my well being and recovery

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.  However, it sounds as if the issue you wish to raise is to do with planning. Local planning issues are the responsibility of your local council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors 

You could also contact your local MP. You can use this page to find out who your local MP is and how to contact them: 

http://www.parliament.uk/mps-lords-and-offices/mps/
